title: White House debt limit meeting ends without a breakthrough
description: House majority Republicans, fixated on curbing spending, refuse to lift the debt ceiling. Failure to raise the limit in a timely manner could trigger 'financial and economic chaos'.

title: 'ChatGPT, a pathological liar that creates quite remarkable pastiches of science'
description: In his column, Jean-Baptiste Fressoz horifically recounts a conversation with the popular AI software, in which it creates completely false scientific references.

title: Champions League: Madrid and Man City draw 1-1 in first leg of semifinal matchup
description: Vinicius Junior and Kevin de Bruyne each scored long-range strikes in the Spanish capital. The second leg will be played next week in Manchester.

title: Syria, Saudi Arabia to reopen embassies restoring diplomatic ties
description: The restoration of diplomatic ties comes more than a decade after Riyadh withdrew its representatives during Syria's civil war, and two days after the Arab League bloc ended Syria's years-long suspension.

title: Deinfluencers: A real stance or greenwashing influence?
description: In a context of galloping inflation and environmental concerns, the phenomenon of advising against buying certain products is developing on social media, though not without questions.

title: EU's Von der Leyen unveils plan against attempts to circumvent Russian sanctions
description: The European Commission is proposing to give the EU a tool to prevent exports of certain dual-use goods to third countries if it is proven that they are destined to end up in Russia.

title: Trump found liable for sexually abusing writer
description: A federal jury in New York City found that Donald Trump sexually abused E. Jean Carroll and ordered Trump to pay $5 million in damages for sexual assault and defamation.

title: In the heart of Mexico's battle for water
description: There have been numerous conflicts between local populations and manufacturers such as Danone, Nestlé and Coca-Cola over the decrease in water availability.

title: AFP journalist killed by rocket fire in eastern Ukraine
description: Arman Soldin and his Agence France-Presse (AFP) colleagues came under fire in eastern Ukraine while they were with a group of Ukrainian soldiers.

title: Outbreak of inter-ethnic violence in the Indian state of Manipur
description: The northeastern region of India is the scene of clashes between the dominant ethnic group and the tribes living in the forests bordering Myanmar.

title: 'Trump had dreamed of industrially rearming the US in the face of China. Biden made it happen'
description: With 18 months to go before the elections, the US is displaying a new social and nationalist consensus based on reindustrialization and massive domestic subsidies.

title: Israeli strike kills three Islamic Jihad leaders in Gaza, risking conflict escalation
description: Four women and four children also died in the Israeli attacks. The army is testing the solidarity of the Palestinian armed movements.

title: US states roll out red carpet to investors from around the world
description: Since the adoption of the Chips Act and the Inflation Reduction Act, which heavily subsidize the semiconductor industry and the energy transition, there has been a rush to invest in the US.

title: 'To build a stronger European Union, we must definitively integrate the Balkans'
description: While the legitimacy of the EU is constantly challenged in this region by China, Russia and Turkey, it is urgent to accelerate the integration of Albania, Bosnia, Kosovo, Northern Macedonia, Montenegro and Serbia, says French MP Frédéric Petit.

title: European integration: 'Let's avoid the shock of going from 27 to 35 member states in one go'
description: Amid the Ukrainian haste and delays in the accession of the Balkan countries, the European Union must reflect on a method of integration, writes the director of the Paris-based Jacques Delors Institute Sébastien Maillard.

title: Macron honors French Resistance while avoiding pots and pans demonstrations
description: In the prison where resistance fighters Jean Moulin and Marc Bloch were detained, the French president on Monday called for unity amidst continued protests over his pension reform.

title: Zelensky slams EU's 'unacceptable' restrictions on Ukrainian grain exports
description: Speaking alongside the European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen in Kyiv on Tuesday, the Ukrainian president demanded that the 'severe, even cruel' restrictions must be lifted.

title: NBA playoffs: Walker takes center stage as LA Lakers defeat Golden State Warriors
description: The Los Angeles Lakers pulled out a thriller in Game 4 on Monday, defeating the Golden State Warriors, 104-101, to take a commanding 3-1 series lead.

title: Turks abroad wrap up voting in landmark election
description: Millions of Turks living abroad finished voting on May 9 in a tense election pitting President Recep Tayyip Erdogan against Kemal Kilicdaroglu.

title: Putin marks Victory Day by condemning ‘war launched’ against Russia
description: The Kremlin limited the scope of the celebrations of the victory against Nazi Germany, the most popular celebration in Russia and the foundation of national unity.

title: Wagner's Prigozhin says Russian army unit fled Bakhmut
description: The head of the private military group, whose influence has risen hugely on the back of Moscow's Ukraine offensive, released a series of scathing videos attacking Russia's military leadership in recent days.

title: Former Pakistan PM Imran Khan arrested during court appearance
description: The former prime minister of Pakistan was arrested by military police in Islamabad after appearing in court in a corruption case.

title: European Parliament calls on member states to improve spyware oversight
description: The European Parliament spyware inquiry committee completed its work on May 8. Its report calls on the Commission to improve oversight of the use of these tools and tighten control of or even block their export.

title: Serbians march in anger at president Vucic after last week's shootings
description: Tens of thousands marched in Belgrade and other Serbian cities on Monday after two shootings last week left 17 dead.

title: Musk says inactive Twitter accounts being purged
description: The latest move comes after news outlets and broadcasters like NPR left Twitter in protest of being labeled 'state-affiliated' or 'government-funded' media.

title: Canada is battling early and intense forest fires in Alberta
description: Nearly 375,000 hectares had gone up in smoke by Monday, while about 100 forest and brush fires were still burning.

title: Vandal of controversial painting at Paris museum is a former elected member of French far-right party
description: An elderly man was apprehended on May 7 for defacing a painting by the Swiss artist Miriam Cahn at Paris' Palais de Tokyo museum.

title: China to expel Canadian diplomat in tit-for-tat move
description: China warned Canada to stop 'unreasonable provocations' on Tuesday, May 9, after they made tit-for-tat consular expulsions in a diplomatic row.

title: EU's von der Leyen marks 'Europe Day' in Kyiv
description: The president of the European Commission travelled on an overnight train from Poland to meet with Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky and work on his country's quest for possible EU membership

title: Behind Russia's obsession with 1945 victory lies a cult of endless war
description: A Soviet-era inheritance, the celebration of the Great Patriotic War is now manipulated by Vladimir Putin to gain public support for the conflict in Ukraine.

title: Businessman Hugues Mulliez on trial in Greece for a boating accident
description: In August 2019, Frenchman Hugues Mulliez was driving a speedboat when it hit a fishing boat, killing two of its occupants and seriously injuring the third. He has been charged with "negligent homicide." The case will go to trial on Tuesday, May 9 in Nafplio.

title: Israeli air strikes in Gaza leave nine dead
description: Among the dead are civilians as well as leaders of the Islamic Jihad. Israeli authorities have told citizens to expect retaliatory strikes.

title: 'After many years of posing nude, I say to myself: I'm fat and that's how I like my body'
description: 'First times': our series on pivotal moments during the transition to adulthood. This week, Hélèna, a 23-year-old actress, tells us how she deconstructed her prejudices about beauty by posing for drawing workshops.

title: Texas man who killed 8, including migrants, charged with manslaughter
description: The 34-year-old drove his SUV into a group of eight men waiting at a bus stop opposite a homeless shelter known for welcoming migrants. Several of the victims were from Venezuela.
